solution_line_template: First find the total time Carson spends mowing: {num_lines_to_mow} lines * {time_per_line} minutes/line = <<{num_lines_to_mow}*{time_per_line}={mowing_time}>>{mowing_time} minutes
Then find the total number of flowers Carson plants: {num_rows_flowers} rows * {flowers_per_row} flowers/row = <<{num_rows_flowers}*{flowers_per_row}={total_flowers}>>{total_flowers} flowers

Then multiply that number by the time taken to plant each flower to find the total time spent planting flowers: {time_per_flower} minutes/flower * {total_flowers} flowers = <<{time_per_flower}*{total_flowers}={planting_time}>>{planting_time} minutes

Finally, add that time to the time spent mowing to find the total time spent gardening: {planting_time} minutes + {mowing_time} minutes = <<{planting_time}+{mowing_time}={total_gardening_time}>>{total_gardening_time} minutes
